links.title: Analysts worry Apple iPhone sales are even worse than they thought
links.description: David Mareuil | Anadolu Agency | Getty Images A disappointing forecast from a key Apple chipmaking partner has some Wall Street analysts worried about iPhone sales forecasts. links.title: 17 Reasons Why Fitbit Versa Is The Best Smartwatch Out There
links.description: Who says smartwatches are dead? They're not what you call as must-haves, sure, but they can still prove pretty useful, especially for someone looking to get fit. Enter the Fitbit Versa, the fitness company's sophomore attempt at a smartwatch after 2017's Ionic.

The 'very close' race to $1T between Apple, Amazon, Alphabet and Microsoft $AAPL $AMZN $GOOGL $MSFT @jimcramer @cnbc https://cnb.cx/2HgdKkL

links.title: Cramer tracks the 'very close' race to $1 trillion between Apple, Amazon, Alphabet and Microsoft
links.description: The race to a $1 trillion market cap is underway, and it's looking "very close" to Jim Cramer, host of CNBC's " Mad Money." Leading the pack is iPhone maker Apple, with a market cap of $877 billion. In second place is Google parent Alphabet at $757 billion, followed by Amazon at $754 billion and Microsoft at $740 billion.
